definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
to rejoice in grandiose deeds/to strive to achieve extraordinary things

sentences.english: My sincere congratulations on this auspicious event of yours.
sentences.chinese: 值你俩大喜之日，谨致最诚挚的祝贺。

sentences.english: The day she entered college was a big day for her.
sentences.chinese: 她进大学的那一天是她的大喜之日。

sentences.english: Today is the day my brother gets married.
sentences.chinese: 今天是哥哥和嫂子结缡的大喜日子。

sentences.english: The yuan non-deliverable forward market isn't expecting significant appreciation for the next year.
sentences.chinese: 让市场大喜过望的人民币在下一年完整不被看好。

sentences.english: Back after black box, ray big mother.
sentences.chinese: 夺回黑盒子之后，雷母大喜。

sentences.english: "The students are just overjoyed, " says MIT architecture associate professor John Ochsendorf.
sentences.chinese: “学生们大喜过望，”MIT建筑学会的教授J说。

sentences.english: You know- today is your wedding day so you are often 1 hour lhproposas.
sentences.chinese: 此日是你的大喜之日，但你却早退了一个小时。

sentences.english: You know, today is your wedding day but you are 1 hour late.
sentences.chinese: 今天是你的大喜之日，但你却迟到了一个小时。

sentences.english: Mrs Durbeyfield was only too delighted at this tractability.
sentences.chinese: 看见苔丝这样听话，德北菲尔德太太不由得心中大喜。

sentences.english: It is a great happy event.
Like the Li Shiwu eyeing gold deep water.
sentences.chinese: 好大喜功的李士武盯上了金深水。

sentences.english: Zhao allow m children's request, see great m.
sentences.chinese: 赵敏容许徐峰看孩子的请求，徐峰大喜。

sentences.english: The outcome of the game is beyond his fondest hopes.
sentences.chinese: 比赛结果使他大喜过望。

sentences.english: He'll be overjoyed at your news .
sentences.chinese: 他一定对你的消息大喜过望。

sentences.english: He'll is overjoyed at your news.
sentences.chinese: 他一定对你的消息大喜过望。

definition: to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
hidden smile/smirk/to rejoice covertly/secret satisfaction concerning one's evil plans
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to have heard what was said
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
